intro: Ctenium newtonii var. productum, commonly known as the coastal ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern California. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes or along the shoreline. It plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and provides habitat for various insects. Due to its limited range, it is considered a rare and sensitive species.
